info.desc: Mark up control labels from a graphical user interface.

item.p: The style attribute takes a space-separated list of style hints. Processing tools should adjust their rendering according to those style hints they understand.
The gui element can link to other pages or documents. See for more information.
The gui element can have attributes from external namespaces. See for more information on external-namespace attributes on inline elements.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: The gui element is similar to the deprecated interface element in DocBook. DocBook 3 introduced more specific elements for marking up parts of a user interface: guibutton, guiicon, guilabel, guimenu, guimenuitem, and guisubmenu. In practice, there is rarely a need to distinguish between types of interface elements in markup. When such a need arises, it can be handled using attributes on a single element. Furthermore, DocBook's various elements are nowhere near exhaustive. Thus, authors must frequently either abuse a specific element or use the deprecated interface element.
